message: Somehow a streaming API makes sense here...
I'm interested in making local feeds showing who is committing code to what repositories nearby. It'd use the public timeline feed, a call to get user info, and possibly a call to get commit info.
Is it possible to request a higher limit on the GitHub API than 60 req/minute?
Yeah, if you have a valid reason for it.  We don't do it often though.
We've toyed with the idea of increasing that number for people using the oauth API.
There would definitely be caching involved on my side but I would probably go over the API limit.
I'd be ok going through the OAuth API.
we've discussed a streaming API but it's still a ways off
@benbjohnson if you get a prototype going that shows promise but is really hitting the API limits open a support ticket and we'll see what we can do
that's normally how things have gotten on the whitelist in the past
